Subjective: Left ear pain and sensation of water for 2-3 days; gradually worsening. Pain 3-4/10, increases to 6-7/10 after showering. Associated decreased hearing in left ear. Unable to swim due to pain. Recently started swimming. Cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week. No fever or feeling generally unwell. No smoking/alcohol. Request: Wants pain to stop; worried about hearing.
Objective: Vitals: Temp 36.2 C. Right Ear: Normal external canal and tympanic membrane. Left Ear: Pain on pinna traction. External auditory canal is red, swollen, and thick. Tympanic membrane not well visualized.
Plan: Paracetamol up to 4000mg daily as needed for pain.
Prescribed acidic, anti-inflammatory ear drops, use three times daily for one week.
Advice: Keep left ear dry for one week. Stop using cotton buds.
Follow-up: Return to clinic in one week for review.
